title: Six found guilty in 2016 Brussels terrorist attacks
description: A Belgian jury convicted six men of terrorist murder in the 2016 attacks at a Brussels airport and subway station that killed 32 and injured more than 300.

title: Trevor Reed, an ex-prisoner in Russia, is hurt fighting in Ukraine
description: Trevor Reed, a Marine veteran whom the Biden administration described as wrongfully detained by Russia, was freed last year in a prisoner exchange with Moscow.

title: Federal judge tosses Biden administration asylum rule for migrants
description: A federal judge ruled against the Biden administration’s new restrictions on seeking asylum, a case that could upend the calm that has taken hold in U.S. border cities.

title: Investigators, denied access in student disappearances, will quit Mexico
description: The international investigators who have spent nearly a decade trying to solve the 2014 disappearance of 43 students from a rural teachers college say have been stonewalled by the Mexican military.

title: France needs ‘order, order, order’ says Macron in first interview since riots
description: After protests over a retirement-age hike, Emmanuel Macron said there would be 100 days of "appeasement" and "unity." In an interview from New Caledonia, he took stock.

title: Savvy politician or ‘hostage’? Netanyahu’s uncertain role in judicial push
description: The chaotic events in the first seven months of Netanyahu's new government have fed speculation that he doesn’t control his coalition as much as it controls him.

title: 125 tombs found after chance discovery of ancient Roman-era cemetery in Gaza
description: Palestinian workers unearthed the tombs and two lead sarcophagi after the 2,000-year-old cemetery was discovered by chance in the Gaza Strip.

title: In photos: Algeria wildfires kill dozens as heat wave hits North Africa
description: The wildfires in Algeria have killed at least 34 people, as the country sweltered under record high temperatures of almost 120 degrees over the weekend.

title: Police remove Greta Thunberg from climate protest hours after court hearing
description: “We cannot save the world by playing by the rules," said Swedish climate activist, just hours after being fined for a June protest.

title: Chinese Foreign Minister Qin Gang removed from post after only 7 months
description: Qin, who was previously China's U.S. ambassador, had not been seen in almost a month. No reason was given for the abrupt end to his meteoric rise.

title: Israel’s crisis swells with first law enacted to curb Supreme Court
description: Israel's daily newspapers were black after the passage of the law curbing Supreme Court powers, but in the Knesset, euphoria reigned as the conservative coalition introduced new laws.

title: China’s new labor challenge: Too many workers, not enough jobs
description: China's leaders have long promised a better economic future but with growth stalling, competition is fierce for the available - from day laboring to skilled office jobs.

title: Brazil lets public employees start work late to watch women’s World Cup
description: Some 11 million Brazilians watched their team's first women's World Cup game, reports said. Viewership was supported by civil servants given flexible schedules.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Russia threatens retaliation after Moscow drone attack; Odessa fears more strikes
description: Odessa, a Ukrainian port city, braced for more assaults after days of Russian missile attacks that have killed at least one person and injured many more.

title: Putin appeared paralyzed and unable to act in first hours of rebellion
description: Ahead of the mutiny, steps were taken to boost security at the Kremlin, but Putin was uncertain how to respond to a warlord critical to many global operations.

title: Israel’s crisis exposes Washington’s delusion
description: The moment reveals the gulf between the political theater around Israel in Washington and the deepening, dangerous reality on the ground.

title: Richard Barancik, last of ‘Monuments Men’ from World War II, dies at 98
description: His unit, tasked with safeguarding European art and culture amid the destruction and plunder of war, was dramatized in the film "The Monuments Men."
